pros: Interesting international colleagues, good benefits including free tuition if you want to pursue a degree there related to your position and more vacation days due to school schedule
cons:
Poor management and a very divisive work culture, very us vs them, very talented people pushed out due to politics.

Even though it is technically a non-profit, students who should not be admitted due to academic performance and ability are admitted in order to keep tuition numbers up.
